Back to Prim One

22
Sep0
Hot:

Back when metaTip was launched in Dec 22nd, I had extremely high hopes for it.  I wanted it to be the next best thing, for every club in SL to swear by it, and still to this day I feel it’s better than all the rest.  While I’ve had some  programming challenges in getting it in tune to the liking of the needs of my clients, I’ve felt some little successes as I feel metaTip grow into that original concept I had started with. Which is why I’m doing some serious development on metaTip to make it one of the best products out there. 

My goals for metaTip:

1. Extremely User-Friendy
2. Integrity – It just works.
3. Auto setup, you shouldn’t have to lift a finger
4. Improved web admin – everything you need in one handy location
5. Extreme flexibilty to work in the conditions you set them in.

Some other plans I have is based on your feedback.  Many of you have expressed concern with the way that  commissions are paid out…whether it is the way the groups work or the fact that the money isn’t coming from your pocket.  These are all valid concerns and I intend to address all of them. One thing I plan on doing is making a private option version of metaTip.  Almost a You-host-it type of structure.  The backend code will all be handled by me, but the actual avatar and jars will be handled by you.

The price point for the private version has yet to be determined; however, any updates on such will be posted here.

Community Features:
Did you know we have a knowledge base?  Yup, it’s located here. 

http://www.sublimegeek.com/support

Join us on our popular page and show your support! 
http://popular.sublimegeek.com

Follow us on Twitter! @sublimegeek

metaTip Upgrade to 1.3.8

6
Jul0
Hot:

When my wife had tipped me to show up on the web-based top tipper board I immediately noticed something was wrong, her entry was the only one on the board (which there used to be several) and all it showed was L$1 which was definately incorrect.

Well, after making some minor adjustments to the in-world and web-end code it seems this small bug has been squashed.  The new metaTip is available to 1.3.8 and both boards work perfectly now.

Check out our knowledge base! http://www.sublimegeek.com/support

Minor upgrades across the board

30
Jun0
Hot:

While the functionality is identical to all previous versions, the purpose has changed.  The update scripts in all of my products needed to be updated in order to properly distribute the new versions of my products out to all of my customers.  Previously, the new updates would only get you new product on rez.  Well, many products such as the GridSplode and metaVotr are never really rezzed more than once.

So, the product versions were modified slightly to trigger an update in the system.  All you have to do is re-rez the box you have an the new update will  be sent out.  If you have any issues as always, just create a ticket at http://sublimegeek.com/support

Sublime Geek Phone Support

22
May0
Hot:

Now this is just too wicked… Apparently Second Life and Vivox are at it again…  Basically, you can call these numbers listed below, dial the extention, and you will be connected via SL Voice to an avatar…

If you need to reach me, dial whichever number is best for you and enter in the extention 154272# and you’ll either be connected to me or my voicemail.  Again, wicked.

metaTip Upgrade to v1.3.3 – Time for an upgrade!

21
Jan0
Hot:

Well, after toiling with the nuiances of v1.2, bugs still being present and things not working as expected, v1.3.3 was born.  Their are a couple new features, but mostly bug fixes.

Release Notes:

  • metaTip system is no longer free.  Removed 5% commission to creator and set the base price at L$1750.  This was due to customer feedback.  This is the base price, as more features are added I may raise the price, but that is still up in the air.  I would appreciate any feedback one this.
  • Fixed API failing to update itself in both the control panel and the tip jars.
  • Control Panel is now in HUD form for ease of use.
  • Re-engineered scripts for the tip jars for private customization by clubs.
  • Prepared tip jar scripts for future droppable capability.
  • Added 4 more designs versus the stock tip jar design including Star, Notes, Heart, & Shield.
  • Tip jars have a preset color choice in addition to the custom color choice.  The custom is in RGB vector format <RRR,GGG,BBB>.
  • Control Panel HUD now broadcasts API to all tip jars in the area of 100m for easy setup.  Tip jars are practically rez and go
  • Fixed rotations on Float / No Float settings.
  • Objects will stay afloat if they were in float status before after changing color, tip text or tip message.
  • Control panel HUD now correctly takes you to the admin page without having to reset it.

Coming Soon in v1.4.0:

  • LILO – LogIn / LogOut Capability…it’s done, just testing at this point for last minute bugs.
  • DataDigger – Web Upgrade Only, adding more detailed information specific to employees, employee rankings, tipper ratings, comparisons, and anything else people need.
  • User HUD – Shows their pocketed amounts at any given time, top tipper, last tipper, etc.
  • Control Panel HUD Mod – Adding quick stats to the HUD to get quick info without having to go to to the admin page.

If you have a feature suggestion or have detected an issue with your product, I want to know.  Email me at support@sublimegeek.com or visit http://www.sublimegeek.com/support/

Thanks for all the support and feedback!

Best Regards,
Jon Desmoulins, Sublime Geek CEO
